title: College Student's $20 Rowboat Project Grows Into $300 Misunderstanding
description: Frederick Arlington Cole, a student at Graham Junior College in Boston, tells of a $20 rowboat he planned to build that grew into a $300 misunderstanding involving two sheriff's departments, two police departments and two fire departments.

title: Music
description: PHOTOGRAPHERS were summoned to Orchestra Hall recently to record the first facetoface confrontation between Georg Solti, the Chicago Sym phony's music director, and Carlo Maria Giulini, the en semble's principal guest con ductor. Solti, short and mittel European, arrived in casual attire. Giulini, long and Latin, came in understated boutique pizzazz. The Mutt and Jeff picture they presented was ludicrous. But as they con versed in a mixture of three languages, the deference paid the Hungarian by the Italian altered the comic vision. It was soon apparent who ruled the roost.

title: Association of Black Cowboys Brings a Rodeo to Jersey City
description: Association of Black Cowboys Brings a Rodeo to Jersey CityJERSEY CITY, April 24  There were thundering hoof beats and hearty hiyo's here today, but no Lone Ranger these cowboys wore Afros.

title: Barbara Bloch Becomes Bride
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo.. April 24Miss Barbara Bloch and Yehuda Vinitsky were mar ried here today in the New Reform Temple by Rabbi Stuart Davis.

title: Et Al.
description: The late Mr. Abrams was a handsome thoughtsman who knew urbanism and particular ly New York urbanism. He wrote a column on the city for The New York Post and once gave Mayor Wagner a hard time with a series on rats. He was nearly persuaded to run for mayor himself. This book is a private glossary of planning terms accumulated over his last 17 years' work. It's informal, idiosyncratic and useful.

title: Printcraft Bowlers to Hold Tourney Here This Week
description: Madison Square Garden's bowling center and the New Yorker Hotel will be the sites of the 29th annual National Printcraft Bowling Association tournament and convention next Friday, Saturday, Sunday and Monday.

title: To the Editor:
description: Concerning the morality of the war in Vietnam, the important question Is not whether exPresident Johnson is techni cally liable for prosecution un der the Hague treaty of 1907. That is an academic matter.

title: HusbandWife Sail Teams Increasing
description: If your wife hates golf, won't play tennis, and booby traps your bridge bidding, take heart. There's still some thing you can share for fun.

title: Retraining Fund Announced
description: WASHINGTON, April 24 (A) A Federal grant of $504,622 for retraining jobless aerospace workers in Florida has been an nounced by Representative Louis Frey Jr., Republican of Florida. He said the Depart ment of Health, Education and Welfare was providing $250,522 for institutional training and the Department of Labor was making available $254,100 for living allowances.

title: Australia Sets Back Japan in Davis Cup Doubles but Trails in Series, 2 to 1
description: TOKYO, April 24 (AP)Aus tralia, battling to avoid Davis Cup elimination and its first loss to Japan in 50 years, re mained alive in the Eastern Zone competition today when the doubles team of Robert Giltinan and Colin Dibley de feated Junzo Kawamori and Takeshi Koura, 61, 3.6, 119, 61.

title: Kemper Penney Becomes Bride Of Mining Man
description: Miss Willa Kemper Penney, a granddaughter of the late James Cash Penney, founder of the department store chain, was married here yesterday afternoon to Michael Alex ander Panayotopulos of Sands Point, L. I., and Athens.

title: Recordings
description: REMEMBER Strephon in Gilbert and Sullivan's Iolanthe'? Halffairy and halfmortal, he could only squeeze halfway through a keyhole. Remem ber Frederick in the same pair's The Pirates of Penz ance? Because he was born on Feb. 29, he was going to he apprenticed to the pirates till he was 84his 21st birth day. Or think of Ruddigore, in which portraits step down from their frames to con verse and sing.

title: Earth Shook but Not Cool Cat's Cue
description: CLIFTON, N. J. During the world pocket billiards tournament in Los An geles two months ago, some of the spectators began to stir in the shadows beyond the brightly lit green felt tables. Their sudden movement intruded on Ray Martin's concentration as he waited for his opponent to miss.

title: Dow Plans Advisory Panel
description: MIDLAND, Mich., April 24 (UPI)  The Dow Chemical Company says it will establish an environmental testing ad visory board to study the pos sible environmental effects of new products. The board also will advise the company on the safety needs of the public and assess environmental effects of changes in manufacturing pro cesses, a spokesman for the company said.

title: Mrs. O'Donnell Remarried
description: Mrs. Priscilla Wells O'Don nell, daughter of the late Mr. and Mrs. Clinton Fisk Wells of Chevy Chase, Md., was married yesterday to Kent Watterson Miller Jr., son of Mr. Miller of Middleburg, Va., and Mrs. Theodora Miller of San Francisco. The ceremony took place in a church on Portsmouth Island on the Outer Banks of North Caro lina. The bride's previous marriage ended in divorce. The bridegroom lives in Waterford, Va., and like his father, owns and trains race horses. He is a greatgrand son of the late Henry Watter son, who was editor in chief of The Courier Journal of Louisville.

title: Storm at West Point Washes Away Tents Of Boy Scout Camp
description: WEST POINT, N. Y., April 24 Several hundred Boy Scouts were driven from their camp ing grounds at the United States Military Academy to night by a violent electrical storm that dumped sleet and rain.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR: The description of poi in Those Tahitians Know How to Live by Jonathan Donald (Travel section, April 4) as the sweet made from pa paya was an error. Poi is food made from the taro root. Polynesians eat it as other cultures partake of bread. Purplebrown in color and thick in consistency, it is eaten along with other foods, and natives usually scoop it up withand eat it from the hand. It is claimed that strong teeth and bones are related to the consumption of poi. Although natives con sume it with great zest, poi is not sweet. To me it seemed to taste of thinned out, col ored cement.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, April 24  Secre tary of State Rogers is beginning to play an Increasingly significant role in the Nixon Administration's forelgn policy planning.

title: 60% IN POLL FAVOR LOCAL VOTING AT 18
description: Six in 10 Americans favor lowering the voting age to 18 for local and state elections, with a majority in each of the four major regions of the na tion expressing approval, the Gallup Poll reported yesterday.

title: After Decade in Vietnam: An Anthropologist's View
description: Despite an atmosphere in South Vietnam of confusion and doubts, Dr. Hickey's voice has been a scholarly and often a sharp one. When he appears in Washington on May 13 to testify on South Vietnam's dis placed persons before the Sen ate Foreign Relations Commit tee, whose chairman is J. W. Fulbright, he will not be at a loss to suggest how to end the war.

title: Letter to the Editor 10  No Title
REAGAN ASSISTANT BALKS AT INQUIRY

title: MAIN PAN CAPTURES SPRINT AT SUFFOLK

title: OPERA AT CURTIS MAKES FINE START
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 24 Since its founding here in 1924, the Curtis Institute of Music has been famous for its production of instrumental vir tuosos, has turned out some prominent composers (the best known of whom are Samuel Barber and Gian Carlo Menotti) and has nurtured some worthy singers, but until this season it gave scant attention to opera.

title: Old Canals Are Dried and Forgotten
description: When you say New York, Canals, most people think; there was only one  and it is still in use  the New York State Barge Canal, for merly the Erie Canal. It was opened in 1825, extends 350 miles across New York State, is the longest and probably the only one that made mom ey, and it ushered in the Canal Age.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I have read the two articles on the new rent law by Assem blymari Richard N. Gottfried and Commissioner Benjamin Altman. I am appalled and shocked, as many tenants are or will be, at the proposed 7 per cent per year in crease advocated by the com missioner.

title: Crosby Lone U.S. Survivor
description: MOSCOW, April 24 (AP) John Crosby was the only American on the men's team to survive elimination today from an international gymnastics competition, while two Ameri can girls, the surprises of the meet, made the top six in the women's competition and earned a chance at a medal.

title: PLANNING EXPANSION ON L.I.
description: JERICHO, L. I., April 24 The Nassau  Suffolk Young Men's Christian Association, which has been serving the public on Long Island since 1919, is hoping to more than double the number of its branches by 1985.

title: The Panther Pathology
description: The Black Panther trials in New Haven and New York have disclosed some appallingly brutal infighting among these militant groups, entirely apart from the charges at issue. In Harlem, a Panther has recently been mur dered in cold blood by a dissident faction. Several days ago eight persons associated with the Panthers were arrested following the executionlike murder in Queens of a West Coast Panther official. Threats have been publicly exchanged between disciples of the New York, California and Algiers commanders.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor:I refer to the story Watchdogs From Within (March 21), and particularly the mention of the efforts of the Chrysler Corporation.

description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., April 23 Last year, in the debut of a network television series about a fictitious United States Sena tor, an industrial community found itself caught up in air pollution crisis.

title: Nicklaus,With 209, Leads by 5 Shots
description: RANCHO LA COSTA, Calif., April 24Jack Nicklaus gained a fivestroke lead in the Tournament of Cham pions today and admitted he has an advantage over the course here. With a third round of 69 for a 54hole aggregate of 209, the sturdy Professional Golfers' Asso ciation champion said, I can get the ball out of the rough but the majority of the guys can't. If it were real rough no one could move it.

title: Tanzania Runner Stalled
description: DAR ES SALAAM, Tranzania, April 24 (AP)Tanzania has re fused to allow its top sprinter, Norman Crihota, to take part in met in Tel Aviv next month to mark the 23d anniversary of Israel's independence.

The cruises afford not only pleasant, unharried holidays but also, with the help of professional guides and lecturers, some delving into antiquity.

title: Home Improvement
description: GYPSUM wallboard, which has almost completely replaced plaster on interior walls and ceilings of newly constructed homes, is also the simplest and least ex pensive material for the do it  yourselfer to use when finishing the interior of new additions to the house, when finishing walls and ceilings of basements, attics or ga rages, or when resurfacing old plaster walls that are al most beyond repair (new wallboard can be nailed up over old plaster by driving nails directly into the studs in most cases  otherwise horizontal furring strips may have to be nailed up first). It lends itself to any type of interior decorative fin ish (paint, wallpaper, etc.) and it is easily patched up if errors are made in in stallation, or if damage oc

title: ST. JOSEPH'S VICTOR IN PRESIDENT'S CUP
description: POUGHKEEPSIE, April 24 St. Joseph's College scored easy victories in the freshman and varsity events at the Pres ient's Cup Regatta on the Hud son River today. The Hawks took the cup for the third straight year, defeating the University of Massachusetts by three lengths against a stiff wind and tide in 8 minutes 42.4 seconds for 2,000 meters.

title: PACERS BEAT STARS, EVEN PLAYOFFS, 33
description: SALT LAKE CITY, April 24 (AP)Mel Daniels and Roger Brown led an Indiana surge in the fourth quarter that gave the Pacers a 105102 victory over the Utah Stars tonight and tied their series at 33.

title: Gallery Displayed JewelsSo Did Guests
description: PARISIt was a grand and glittering occasion the likes of which Paris hadn't seen in many a month. After two years of work and at a cost of $1million, Wally F. Findlay watched contentedly as Arthur K. Watson, the United States Ambassador to France, and Jacques Baumel, the French State Secretary for the Presidency, simultaneously cut the red, white and blue ribbons to the en trance of the first exhibition in Paris's Wally F. Findlay Galleries International.

title: Hoist the Flag Is Inundated by Mail
description: Hoist The Flag, the favorite to win the Kentucky Derby until his racing career ended during a training blowout a month ago, has received letters and telegrams from all over the country, The United Press International reports.

title: Et Al.
description: A black, namedropping, swinging, existential, sunerin tellectual literary critic? A friend of Ralph Ellison? An uptown Edmund Fuller? A Fre quent Lecturer? Prolific Wri ter? (Four books between 1966 and 1969, excluding volumes edited.) Who is this wonder? Gentlemen, it is Nathan Scott, now offering modernisttheolog ical lit readings in postTillich rhetoric with a good shake of Heidegger  the kind of book that makes divinity students feel like scholars of the liberal arts.

title: A Disillusioned Marcher No Longer Backs Nixon
description: WASHINGTON, April 24 I voted for Nixon, Charles Hughes said as he marched among the youths down Penn sylvania Avenue this afternoon. He was talking softly, but that single sentence brought a sur prising number of stares from those around him, and, rather defensively, he tried to explain.

title: MADISON AVE.
description: Dr Pepper, one of Amer ica's oldest soft drinks, came back to New York last year in its second attempt to crack the nation's biggest, richest and toughest markets.

title: Sudden Panic Grips Duvalier Mourners In Funeral March
description: PORTAUPRINCE, Haiti, April 24With pomp and liturgy and a few touches of terror, Haiti today buried its national leader, Dr. Francois Duvalier, the enigmatic. dicta. for who ruled this impoverished black republic for 13 and a half years.

title: Factory Church on L.I. Seeking a New Industrial Site
description: HAUPPAUGE, L.I., April 24 St. Thomas More Roman Catholic Church, which con ducts services in a onestory factory building in the Van derbilt Industrial Park here, may lose its unusual place of worship.

title: J. L. McCormick Becomes Fiance Of Karin Rosen
description: Miss Karin Rosen and John Lawrence McCormick, pres ident of Bonniers, the New York specialty shop, plan to be married in Stockholm on June 5.

title: Coed Liberates Bowling Tourney
description: Marion Voight, an 18year old freshman at John Jay College of Criminal Justice in Manhattan, has obtained an injunction from the New York State Supreme Court, in Manhattan to permit her to compete in the Eastern re gional tournament of the Na tional Collegiate individual match bowling championships.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTONRace relations and politics, the perennial flint and steel of American public life, struck sparks of contro versy again last week over the busing of children to promote school integration.

title: Head of Philosophy Society
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 24 (AP)Dr. Leonard Carmichael, vice president for research and exploration of the National Geographic Society was re elected president of the Ameri can Philosophical Society Fri day at the annual general meeting.

title: Dance
description: WE all know quite a lot about classic ballet in every country with the exception of China. I have, of course, seen the remark able dancertumbleracrobats of the Peking Opera, which, perversely enough, although called the Peking Opera is, in effect, a dance company, and one of the best trained troupes in the world. For ob vious reasons, the Peking Opera has never visited the United States, and I think it has not even been in Western Europe since its tour of 1966.

title: New LifeSaving Device Size of a Grapefruit
description: A new lifesaving device the size of a grapefruit has been introduced to the boating in dustry. Called AquaMate and distributed by Columbia In ternational Corporation of Long Island City, it weighs 91/2 ounces and can easily he thrown about 100 feet toward a person in danger of drowning.

title: Please, No 80, Girls, 80
description: SOMEONE connected with 70, Girls, 70 has an almost mathematic al genius for taking risks that are certain to fail. Let me go over a few of them, just in case anyone else is planning a show to be called 80, Girls, 80.

title: City to Start Accepting Derby Bets Wednesday
description: The city's Offtrack Betting Corporation will open 52 special windows at noon Wednesday for wagering on next Saturday's 97th Kentucky Derby.

title: WASHINGTON REPORT
description: WASHINGTON  It has long been a familiar truth here that when you don't know what to do about a problem, you should appoint a Presidential Commission, reorganize the Government or send a mission abroad.

description: To the Editor:

title: DAVID SENDROFF
description: David Sendroff, pathologist at Sing Sing prison for many years until his retirement in 1969, died Friday at the Kings bridge Veterans Hospital. He was 59 years old and lived at 1 Marble Hill Avenue in Man hattan.

title: Princeton Retains Cup
description: PHILADELPHIA, April 24 Princeton outraced the Penn varsity lightweight crew by one and a half lengths today on the Schuylkill in winning the Wood Hammond Cup for the second straight year.

description: DENVER, April 24  Two small newspapers in eastern Colorado collapsed this week, but they went down with they guns of the bankrupt editor! blazing.

description: To THE EDITOR:

title: 200,000 Rally in Capital to End War
description: WASHINGTON, April 24 Antiwar marchers massed to day at a new rallying point, the Capitol, to urge Congress to assume the leadership they seek to bring the Indochina war to an immediate end.

title: Connally Bills in Texas Firstl
description: WASHINGTON, April 24 (UPI) The first dollar bills bearing the signaure of John . Con nally Jr., the new secretary of the Treasury, will be circulated In Texas beginning next month. The first batch of bills with the former TexasGovernor's signa ture is scheduled for the Dallas Federal Reserve District.

description: WASHINGTON, April 24 This capital now absorbs mas sive antiwar demonstrations al most as calmly as it once absorbed the war.

description: A number of physicists be lieve that, through a variety of atomic experiments, they have begun opening the door to the innermost sanctum of matter.
